events.message: The policyholder reported a car accident that occurred at an intersection causing front-end damage to the vehicle.
Claim has been categorized under Auto Accident after review of the initial report detailing the collision circumstances.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the customer's case and assist with the claim process.
The claim was acknowledged by the insurance company and confirmation was sent to the customer promptly.
Request sent to the claimant for photographs of the vehicle damage, police report, and repair estimates.
Policyholder has submitted all requested documents including pictures, police report and mechanic's repair quote.
The investigation team began review of the submitted evidence and background of the collision claim.
Investigation completed without discrepancies; liability and damage verified according to policy terms.
A fair settlement offer was proposed to the claimant based on damage assessment and coverage limits.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the prompt handling and settlement proposal made by the insurer.
The insurance claim was officially approved after the customer accepted the settlement terms.
Payment was issued to the claimant promptly to cover the agreed repair costs for the vehicle damage.
The claim file was officially closed after payment and all administrative procedures were completed.
The case was archived in the system for future reference following closure of the auto accident claim.
